title: In Hong Kong, a 'mega-events committee' watches over the city's attractiveness
description: 'Everything is fine' is the message that the Hong Kong authorities are trying to convey with an increase in festive events, in order to detract from restrictions on its population's freedoms.

title: Egypt: Alaa Abd El-Fattah's family requested a presidential pardon
description: The White House expressed 'deep concern' after the hunger-striker activist's lawyer said he had been refused access to him. He is serving a five-year prison sentence for 'spreading false news' by sharing a post about police brutality.

title: Coffee by candlelight: Kyiv residents adapt to routines of war
description: Russian attacks on infrastructure deprive the capital of electricity for several hours a day, but for Kyiv's residents this has become the new normal.

title: Le Fooding's Christine Doublet: 'The table is where we check in with each other, no matter what'
description: The Franco-American, who grew up in a family of foodies, now heads up the French culinary bible, the Le Fooding guide

title: Backstage access at Fela Kuti's 1980s concerts
description: Photographer Bernard Matussière documented the European tours of the inventor of Afrobeat in the early 1980s.

title: COP27: Biden urges world to 'step up' in climate fight
description: The President said his $369bn 'greening' package was an example to the rest of the world, but did not address calls for the US to compensate developing countries for climate disasters.

title: Macron's tactical threat: Calling early elections
description: Emmanuel Macron's supporters only constitute a relative majority at the Assemblée Nationale, and every piece of legislation is a struggle. But the president has the power to dissolve the chamber to try to renew the political landscape.

title: Cryptocurrency platform FTX goes bankrupt as CEO Sam Bankman-Fried resigns
description: The embattled cryptocurrency exchange said it will initiate bankruptcy proceedings in the US, triggering potentially one of the biggest meltdowns in the industry.

title: There will be 8 billion of us on Earth on November 15. How big will the world population grow?
description: Based on the latest projections of UN demographers, the world population is expected to peak in the 2080s, with about 10.4 billion people.

title: COP27 hosts a record number of fossil fuel lobbyists
description: According to NGOs, 636 people are defending coal, oil and gas at the UN climate conference, up 25% from COP26 and more than any national delegation except for the United Arab Emirates.

title: French army chief: 'Military force is making a brutal return to the international scene'
description: On Armistice Day, France's highest-ranking general Thierry Burkhard highlights the commitment of French soldiers at a time when war has returned to the European continent.

title: End-of-life care: French Constitutional Council rules on how doctors should respect patients' instructions
description: The family of a patient who had expressed his wish to be kept alive, even artificially, challenged a medical decision taken by a French hospital that had called for the cessation of treatment due to 'unreasonable obstinacy.'

title: Nana Darkoa Sekyiamah, the liberated voice of African women's sex lives
description: In her blog, festival and now a book of intimate testimonies, the Ghanaian feminist talks openly about female sexuality in a continent beset by rising conservative forces.

title: Amnesty International reports deportation and forced adoption of Ukrainian children in Russia
description: The Russian authorities claim that these minors are orphans, which the NGO disputes.

title: Russia claims all troops withdrawn from Ukraine's Kherson
description: Moscow said it had made the difficult decision to withdraw following Ukrainian advances in this key southern port city, a move Kyiv called 'an important victory'.

title: Israel's Netanyahu will receive mandate to form government on Sunday
description: The November 1 elections saw the former prime minister end a stalemate after five elections in less than four years.

title: EU predicts recession to hit by winter
description: Europe is reeling from the economic shockwaves unleashed by Russia's war on Ukraine that has fuelled a spike in energy costs.

title: Rescue of Ocean Viking ship fractures relationship between France and Italy
description: France said it would take responsibility and welcome the ship carrying 234 rescued migrants, denouncing the 'irresponsible' behavior of Italy. The Italian interior minister criticized an 'inexplicable reaction' by France.

title: Twitter chaos continues as key executives resign, Musk hints at possible bankruptcy
description: Exodus of top figures handling safety, security, privacy and compliance from the social media giant come amid warnings from US Federal Trade Commission.

title: Global carbon emissions remain at record levels this year
description: Emissions are expected to reach 40.6 billion tonnes in 2022, up nearly 1% from 2021 and still driven primarily by fossil fuel combustion.

title: Slowing US inflation gives some reason for cautious optimism
description: Inflation in the US was 7.7% year-on-year in October. That's less than in September, and less than experts expected. With Wall Street soaring, some economists are cautiously optimistic.

title: Paris metro strike successfully disrupts city, but few demonstrate in the street
description: Train traffic in the Parisian region was severely interrupted by a strike on Thursday, but the call for mobilization in favor of wage increases only attracted 30,000 people, according to the Ministry of the Interior.

title: European Union approves Sanofi's Covid-19 vaccine
description: The European Medicines Agency and the European Commission gave their approval on Thursday for the use of VidPrevtyn Beta, the commercial name of this new vaccine manufactured with the British company GSK.

title: 'We won't have a second planet': Young Ugandans are on the front line of climate activism
description: A new generation of activists is working to raise community awareness of environmental issues at COP27.

title: Facing up to the challenges of the ecological transition
description: Instead of underplaying the changes we need to make in order for them to seem more palatable, we must fully explain them – and, above all, adequately finance them.

title: Macron wants to help break Venezuelan deadlock in talks between Maduro and opposition
description: The French president should meet on Friday, November 11, with Venezuelan president representative Jorge Rodriguez and Gerardo Blyde spokesman for the country's opposition.

title: French economist warns 'the next ten years will be difficult' as government prepares for climate transition
description: Jean Pisani-Ferry, a French economist and policy advisor, warns of the 'negative shocks' that the climate transition will cause, arguing that €70 billion will be needed by 2030.

title: Migrants rescued in the Mediterranean — what does international law say?
description: After several days of diplomatic wrangling with Italy, France decided on Thursday, November 10, to 'exceptionally' allow the humanitarian ship "Ocean Viking" to dock. While maritime law requires the rescue of migrants in danger, it does not state which country should welcome them.

title: COP27: The US' climate plan is ambitious, but comes at a cost to other countries
description: On Friday, US President Joe Biden is expected to highlight a $370 billion bill adopted this summer to reduce the country's greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Emmanuel Macron wants 'world-class cyber defense' for France within five years
description: The French president clarified on Wednesday, October 9, his earlier comments on a deterrent in the event of the use of a nuclear weapon in Ukraine

title: 'The failed GOP takeover is a victory in itself for the Democratic party'
description: US specialist Laurence Nardon notes in her column in 'Le Monde' that the large Republican wave predicted by the polls never materialized, providing the Biden administration two years of relative serenity.

title: Famine looms over Somalia
description: One child is being admitted for medical treatment for malnutrition every minute in Somalia. Humanitarian NGOs are not working in areas under jihadist control.

title: US midterms: Why Nevada election results are taking days
description: The political world is turning its focus to the state of Nevada — which results could determine which party would control the Senate. Here's why it could take several more days until there's clarity on who won.
